stix:STIX_Header.stix:Title: Malware Programmed to DDoS Healthcare.gov
stix:STIX_Header.stix:Description:
On 7 November 2013, a malware artifact submitted for analysis was identified as a DDoS tool programmed to target healthcare.gov.
This document incorporates data originally released as US-CERT MIFR-325206.

stix:Indicator.indicator:Description:
This artifact is a denial of service (DoS) tool written in Delphi 5. This tool opens a web browser and sends a GET request to https://www.healthcare.gov. The form will wait 30 seconds, then navigate to https://www.healthcare.gov/contact‐us/. Every 30 seconds, it will alternate between the two addresses. The tool also includes an "about" text area that describes what it does and has a civil disobedience message. Text below:
---BEGIN TEXT--- Destroy Obama Care.
This program continually displays alternate page of the ObamaCare website. It has no virus, trojans, worms, or cookies.
The purpose is to overload the ObamaCare website, to deny serivce to users and perhaps overload and crash the system.
You can open as many copies of this program as you want. Each copy opens mulitple links to the site.
ObamaCare is an affront to the Constitutional rights of the people. We HAVE the right to CIVIL disobedience! ---END TEXT---
This tool does not appear to have any other functionality.
